intro: Brassica juncea var. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese mustard, is an annual plant native to China. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with erect stems and pinnately lobed leaves. Its seeds are small and yellow, often used in traditional Chinese medicine and as a spice. The plant is also cultivated for its edible leaves and stems, which are used in various culinary applications.
